title: Chicken and bulgar wheat Waldorf salad with dill and poppy seed yogurt

ingredients.item: 2 celery sticks, shaved into ribbons with a vegetable peeler
2 small cox or egremont russet apples (or use jazz or tentation later in the year), cored and thinly sliced

instructions.step: Preheat the oven to 180˚C, gas mark 4. Zest 1 lemon and rub the zest over the chicken with 1 tbsp oil; season. Put the zested lemon in the cavity of the chicken, set in a roasting tin, breast-side down, and roast for 1 hour 20 minutes, turning halfway to breast-side up, until the juices run clear.

Meanwhile, put the bulgar wheat in a large bowl and pour over 300ml boiling water. Leave to soak for about 15 minutes, then fluff up the grains with a fork. Add the walnuts, grapes, celery, salad onions and  the dill; toss together.

Zest and juice the remaining 2 lemons. For the dressing, mix the lemon zest with  the lemon juice, the remaining 2 tbsp oil, the vinegar, honey and mustard; season. For the poppy seed yogurt, mix the remaining lemon juice and dill with the yogurt and poppy seeds; chill until ready to serve.

When the chicken is cooked, remove the whole lemon from the cavity. Holding it over the bowl of dressing, cut it in half and scoop out the flesh; discard the skin. Remove any pips, then mash it into the dressing and whisk in any roasting juices from the chicken.

Shred the chicken and any crispy skin, discarding the bones, then add to the bulgar wheat. Add the apples and dressing, season, then toss everything together. Tip onto a platter and serve with the dill and poppy seed yogurt.
